channel.title: DevHawk tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from DevHawk.

item.description:
This week, we've shipped updates to the #NeoBlockchainToolkit. This brings the toolkit up to date with @Neo_Blockchain v3.3.1 which is running on MainNet today. There are a few new features that I want to point out:
NeoExpress adds a couple new commands: `show notification` and `contract download`.
show notification is pretty straightforward - show notifications records for a given time frame or contract. Basically, fills a gap for command line tracker operations in NeoExpress
Contract Download is much more involved - it downloads a contract + its associated storage records from a public network (i.e. MainNet) and adds them to your local Express chain.
Major thanks to ixje from @coz_official for the contribution!
This release also sees a significant update to Neo.BuildTools. We've added new tasks to automatically run the Neo C# compiler and NeoExpress batch files during the build process.
Dramatically simplifies the project files for C# contract developers: https://t.co/uaWQrcrjo7
No new major features in the Neo Contract debugger for this release. Storage Schema (announced in this thread: https://t.co/SnqmZ0i6fo) is still in preview. v3.3 compatible versions of both production and preview debuggers are available from the @code marketplace
The NGD Enterprise sample contracts Registrar (https://t.co/Xeyt3IrpnO) and NFT (https://t.co/ZnRiYKB8a0) have been updated to the latest Neo + Toolkit bits - including the updated build tools - so you can easily experiment with how these tools work.
Neo Visual DevTracker's C# contract template has also been updated with the new build tools, so creating a new contract will be correctly configured from the get-go.
As usual, I'm around to answer questions about @Neo_Blockchain development both here on Twitter and on the Neo Discord (https://t.co/SYrmRzIa17)
TFW you're driving home after a 7pm hockey game and the sun is still up. I love PNW in the summer https://t.co/3ZfepE6nuU
Today's Workout : 325# squats, 115# overhead press, 345# deadlift. 5x5 work sets (3x5 work sets for deadlift) #StrongLifts5x5
Today's Workout : 320# squats, 180# bench, 170# barbell rows. 5x5 worksets #stronglifts5x5

I suspect Jon Cooper was on the edge of tears because the bolts gave up a third period lead in their own barn to put the 'lanch ahead in the series 3-1. Whining about a marginal call like an over invested little league dad who played ball in college is not a good look Jon. https://t.co/NHh3W4bV0A
@schlummer2k @YatesHeath That's the plan. I hit all 25 reps of 315# so next time I'll do 320#. It's a core principle of most strength training programs : start light, progress slowly, be consistent

Today's Workout: 315# squats, 110# overhead press, 335# deadlifts. 5x5 work sets (3x5 deadlift work sets) #StrongLifts5x5 As my friend @YatesHeath said, this is a nice aesthetic https://t.co/gNe7eN3ogv
We had 8 skaters for hockey today (7 for first period) but we still managed a decent effort, a 3-3 tie. I had a goal and a roughing penalty and was even on the afternoon
My son was nominated for his performance as Amos in Chicago by Seattle Stage Scene! https://t.co/todG18DdiF https://t.co/wM26lSq0rz
@roschler I could bench press Luna's weight - she's under 100#. But I don't think she'd sit still for it if I tried to bench press her
Today's Workout : 305# squats, 175# bench, 165# barbell rows. 5x5 worksets #stronglifts5x5

Just finished this video. Absolutely fantastic, a must watch for any @JamesGunn fan @jessiegender did an amazing job with this video. It felt like she was explaining *to me* why *I* liked @DCpeacemaker so much https://t.co/xlswbanops

My eldest son Patrick is home from university for the summer, interning as a technician for Tesla. We drove by so he knows where he is going tomorrow. Gonna be nice having him home for a while. https://t.co/4NkbPWI0MQ
TFW you realize the source of your heisenbug half asleep at 5am and it turns out you're 100% correct https://t.co/Zt1uDvsJxh
